full_summary:
# Public Works and Government Services Canada: Technical Investigation and Engineering Studies for Naval Platform Survivability Systems

## Tender Details
* Tender reference number: PW-__ML-068-29363
* Solicitation number: W8482-242123/A
* Tender closing date: 2024-07-04T14:00:00
* Procurement category: Services
* Trade agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Regions of opportunity: National Capital Region (NCR), Nova Scotia, British Columbia
* Contracting entity: Public Works and Government Services Canada
* End-user entity: Department of National Defence

## Background
Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) intends to award a contract for Technical Investigation and Engineering Studies (TIES) in support of Naval Platform Survivability Systems (NPSS) for all classes of combatant within the Royal Canadian Navy.

## Technical Investigation and Engineering Studies (TIES)
* The TIES will provide life cycle material management support for NPSS.
* Advanced analytical and software development capability is required in areas specific to weapons effect and signature modeling using Trident and VAST source codes.

## Assessment Criteria for Statements of Capabilities
To be considered, a company must provide evidence of the following:
* At least 5 years of experience providing TIES and NPSS services
* Possession of a license with software development capability of the Trident and VAST source codes
* A team consisting of:
	+ 1 Senior Finite Element Analysis (FEA) Engineer with 10+ years of experience and 5+ years of FEA experience
	+ 1 Senior Computational Fluid Dynamic (CFD) Engineer with 10+ years of experience and 5+ years of CFD experience
	+ 1 Computer Science Specialist with 5+ years of experience
	+ 1 Junior Engineer with a university degree in engineering or a license to practice as a professional engineer

## Notice
This is an Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN) indicating the intention to award a contract to a pre-identified supplier, Martec Limited. Suppliers who consider themselves fully qualified to provide the required services can submit a statement of capabilities to:
